events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of May 9th, resulting in visible damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision incident.
An agent was assigned to the case to handle all communications and coordinate the claims process related to this auto accident.
The customer received acknowledgment of their claim submission with estimated timelines for the claims investigation.
Request sent to the customer for the accident police report, driver’s license copy, and photos showing vehicle damages.
Customer uploaded the requested police report, pictures of the vehicle damage, and a copy of their valid driver’s license.
The claims investigation team began reviewing all submitted documentation and police reports to assess the accident liability.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault and that damages are eligible for coverage.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repairs to the damaged parts of the vehicle plus rental car costs.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved, authorizing payment for the vehicle repairs and ancillary expenses as outlined in the settlement.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer’s designated account promptly following claim approval.
After confirming receipt of payment and satisfaction from the customer, the claim was formally closed in the system.
The case files and all documentation related to the auto accident claim were securely archived for future reference.
